articles.title: ITCZ, easterlies, localized thunderstorms to bring rains over several areas
articles.description: Several areas of the country will have rains on Monday due to an Intertropical Convergence Zone, easterlies, and localized thunderstorms, according to PAGASA's weather forecast.
articles.content:

articles.title: Iran Israel war live updates: Israel counters Iran's attack, targets missile sites
articles.description: Iran Israel war news live: Iran's foreign minister on Sunday said the country does not want the conflict with Israel to spill into neighbouring nations unless compelled, stressing that Iran acted in self-defence and would halt its response if foreign aggression ends.

articles.description: Glamorgan ease to a 40-run victory against Gloucestershire at Bristol.
articles.content: Career-best performances by Asa Tribe (63*), Ben Kellaway (53) and Mason Crane (4/20) helped Glamorgan get back into winning ways as the Welsh county defeated Gloucestershire, the reigning Vitality Blast T20 champions, by 40 runs at Bristol. (writes ... [3871 chars]

articles.title: Man (20s) in critical condition after being found on Dublin road after travelling on e-scooter
articles.description: A man has been hospitalised with serious injuries following a road traffic collision in Dublin.
articles.content:
A man has been hospitalised with serious injuries following a road traffic collision in Dublin.
The incident occurred at Cappagh Road, Finglas, Dublin 11, today.

articles.title: Club World Cup 2025: A mismatch
articles.description: Bayern Munich's Club World Cup group game against Auckland City was a mismatch on the pitch - so why were the part-timers from New Zealand facing the 34-time German champions?
articles.content:
It was one of the biggest mismatches you are ever likely to see in professional football.
For New Zealand part-timers Auckland City, upsetting 34-time German champions and six-time Uefa Champions League winners Bayern Munich was always going to be a ... [1250 chars]

articles.description: New probe and statutory public inquiry will be a means to get ‘truth and justice’, home secretary says
articles.content:
Keir Starmer has launched a sweeping national operation to investigate grooming gangs and a statutory inquiry into institutional failure, marking a significant reversal after months of pressure on Labour to act.

articles.title: Blaise Metreweli named as first woman to lead UK intelligence service MI6
articles.description: Metreweli, 47, has held series of director-level roles in foreign intelligence service and in domestic agency MI5
articles.content:
MI6, the UK’s foreign intelligence service, is to be led by a woman for the first time, Keir Starmer has announced.
